data.text: Constâncio: Monetary policy should not respond to financial stability concerns. The justifying argument for this stance is that macroprudential policy is now available and is the most effective tool for safeguarding financial stability.
Speech Vítor Constâncio: Financial stability risks and macroprudential policy in the euro area https://t.co/4OZyBXGZlz
Speech Peter Praet: Assessment of quantitative easing and challenges of policy normalisation https://t.co/kvZNesVciv
Speech Mario Draghi: Monetary Policy in the Euro Area https://t.co/wwdiLg2Ht5
Cœuré: The emergence of fintech companies increases competition, lowers charges and spurs innovation, but financial intermediation must remain safe and sound.
Financial innovation matters for central banks as it will affect monetary policy, financial stability and payment systems.
Benoît Cœuré is visiting @FinLeap today, a hub for #fintech startups in Berlin. Find out what they are going to talk about! https://t.co/mgcqw0N2sJ
Speech Benoît Cœuré: Interaction between financial regulation and innovation is a two-way street https://t.co/q0SGMcJS5i

Wir freuen uns sehr, am Lichtfestival #Luminale2018 vom 18. bis 23. März in Frankfurt teilzunehmen. Das Künstlerkollektiv Urbanscreen wird zusammen mit @andreaspreis die Nordfassade der Großmarkthalle an unserem Hauptsitz in eine animierte Street-Art-Galerie verwandeln https://t.co/zfDJi5LyT9

We’re excited to take part in the #Luminale2018 light show starting on 18 March in Frankfurt. Artist collective Urbanscreen together with @andreaspreis will turn the north façade of our main building into a graffiti-inspired street art gallery https://t.co/nPbkwcgFpR

https://t.co/rrgwCbKs5f
Press release: ECB releases progress on gender targets https://t.co/u2e01a4fPD
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/iNrr7EwztS
Draghi: I see two main risks today — trade and financial deregulation
Draghi: We are working on improving our gender situation and are undertaking some new initiatives as progress has been less than we want

Draghi: This angst that everything should be clear in advance isn’t seen in markets. There is uncertainty about potential output growth and slack and some members are more uncertain about it than others

Draghi: The current situation as regards anti-money laundering is not satisfactory. There should be more cooperation between national authorities on anti-money laundering and cooperation between national authorities and supervisors
Draghi: We look at the underlying inflation to judge the robustness of convergence
Draghi: The immediate spillover of [US] trade measures is not going to be that big. But we are convinced that disputes should be discussed and resolved in a multilateral framework.
Draghi: On inflation, victory cannot be declared yet
Draghi: We need confidence, persistence and patience

Draghi: We’re sending a letter to the ECJ asking for clarification on whether the security measures placed on the Governor of the Latvian central bank are compliant with Article 14.2 of the ESCB Statute
Draghi: Today's decision was unanimous
Draghi: Deepening Economic and Monetary Union remains a priority. The Governing Council urges specific and decisive steps to complete the banking union and the capital markets union.
Draghi: The implementation of structural reforms in euro area countries needs to be substantially stepped up
Draghi: HICP projections: 1.4% in 2018 [1.4% in Dec], 1.4% in 2019 [1.5%] and 1.7% in 2020 [1,7%]
Draghi: GDP projections: 2.4% in 2018 [2.3% in Dec], 1.9% in 2019 [1.9 %] and 1.7% in 2020 [1,7%]
Draghi: Continued monetary support is provided by the net purchases, the sizeable stock of assets, the forthcoming reinvestments, and by forward guidance on rates
Draghi: An ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary  for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up
Draghi: The Governing Council will continue to monitor developments in the exchange rate and financial conditions with regard to their possible implications for the inflation outlook
Draghi: Underlying inflation remains subdued and has yet to show convincing signs of a sustained upward trend
Draghi: We are confident that inflation will converge toward our inflation aim of below but close to 2% over the medium term
Draghi: Growth in the euro area is projected to expand in the near term at a faster pace than expected
Draghi: New staff projections confirm the strong and broad-based growth momentum in the euro area

Draghi: Net asset purchases, at current monthly pace of €30 bn, are intended to run until the end of September 2018, or beyond, if necessary and at any case until Governing Council sees sustained adjustment in path of inflation consistent with inflation aim
Draghi: We continue to expect interest rates to remain at their present levels for an extended period of time, and well past the horizon of our net asset purchases
